meanings.definition: To pile up or heap up.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys upheaping her toys in a neat stack.
meanings.sent2: The workers were upheaping the bricks to build a sturdy wall.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was upheaping acorns in a comical tower.
meanings.sent4: The students were upheaping questions during the lively debate.
meanings.sent5: The chef was upheaping colorful vegetables on the plate.

meanings.definition: The act of piling up or heaping up.
meanings.sent1: The upheaping of books in the library made it hard to find a specific one.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the upheaping of debris blocked the road.
meanings.sent3: The upheaping of pillows on the bed created a cozy nest.
meanings.sent4: The upheaping of presents under the tree brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent5: The upheaping of sand on the beach formed a small dune.
